abstract: Michael Powell Sports of the Times column reflects on Usain Bolt winning gold in 100 meters at Rio Olympics, third straight Summer Olympics in row in which he has won event; notes Bolt's longstanding rivalry with American Justin Gatlin, who won silver; says Bolt's planned retirement from sport will mark end of era.

headline.print_headline: Titans Clash Before Time Catches Up
headline.main: Usain Bolt’s Showdown With Justin Gatlin Carries a Sense of History’s Passing

snippet: Bolt claimed gold in the 100 meters for the third Summer Olympics in a row, reaffirming his title as the world’s fastest man while beating an aging rival cast as his opposite....
lead_paragraph: Bolt claimed gold in the 100 meters for the third Summer Olympics in a row, reaffirming his title as the world’s fastest man while beating an aging rival cast as his opposite.
